intro: Cienfuegosia hispida, commonly known as the rough cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals, and bloom during the dry season. It is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air.
